No tea in room which would have been nice but there was tea and coffee available on each landing in the morning between 7am-10am so that helped. Room was cleaned every day and bed was remade by maid so it always look neat and tidy. Would recomend this hotel to anyone travelling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “"Incredibly comfortable stay at the Kensington Park Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: medward086
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Kensington Park. The hotel was easy to find, conveniently located near Union Square. Although, I wish the valet had been easier (waiting time can be a bit long, so plan ahead). The lobby was as inviting as the friendly staff. My room had beautiful views of San Francisco's downtown and a very comfortable bed! Great staff, perfect location, and reasonable rates...Coming just from Sacramento I know where I'll be staying on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm tucked amid the hubbub”
Reviews.Author: vermonsters2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kensington Park for our 25th wedding anniversary and it was the perfect place! The personnel were all professional and efficient. We had a welcoming bottle of wine, bottled water, and lovely bathrobes to help us settle in on our "mink" bed throws, which are the icing on the cake to some incredibly comfortable beds. The bathroom was spacious, well lit and the shower had great water pressure and seemingly unlimited hot H2O. The owner graciously phoned us to congratulate us on our anniversary. The KP has a lovely european feel, for those who prefer not to be in cookie cutter style hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable value hotel for downtown San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: SebGo
Reviews.Content: Good location, convenient to the San Francisco business district, Embarcadero, Union Square, shopping, etc. Quiet (enough) room, and comfortable. The place is s a little worn around the edges, sort of like an old English Guest House, but very comfortable and clean. Try the cafe next door (La Taza) for fantastic (and inexpensive) breakfast burritos and espresso.

Reviews.Title: “a very friendly and well located hotel, and reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: rogerdEngland
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at this hotel. Although the old style of furnishings might not suit everyone we loved the warmth that was created by the staff and the small hotel feeling that is unusual for the centre of the city. Dorothy on reception and Bob on the door made an excellent team. Only minutes from Sears the famous breakfast restaurant, and the same distance to the cable cars made it easy to enjoy the city without too much effort. A 3 day bus pass is a must as is a visit to the science museum and the Japanese gardens. A great second trip for us both. roger & Susan England

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, with great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: fowlerc
Reviews.Content: First time in San Fransico, my sister set up the trip including staying at the Kensington. It was great. There were a few minor glitches but when we informed the front desk they were delt with immediately. The room was great. The beds were extremely comfortable and being able to open the window was a big plus. The location was great, a short trip to the warf, around the corner to Union Square and an easy walk to China Town. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, needs a little attention”
Reviews.Author: bjparker
Reviews.Content: Perfect for our stay, but there were a few things that needed attention - getting a little faded around the edges. Free internet was very slow - and they tried to sell a higher speed service which was a bit annoying - either give free internet or don't. But, all in all worth the money so recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that represents the charm of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bea_2010
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location half a block away from Union Square and approximately 30 min walk from SOMA and Fishermans Wharf. Hotel was charming and quirky, pretty foyer, bench seats in elevators, friendly staff. Room was clean and bed comfortable. Several items provided free of charge in the bathroom (ie. razor, toothpaste etc. on top of the standard shampoo/conditioner which was useful.) Yes, the place probably needs to be painted again and the window didn't close but there is an old world charm about the hotel and personally I liked the fact that the windows opened! (No recycled air!!) You can hear the trolleys in the street which made me feel like a part of the city. (Would probably annoy a light sleeper though.) Overall good value!

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable hotel I know”
Reviews.Author: LondonSinger
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Kensington Park three times now, my partner four times. If you ask for a room at the back you will have a very quiet stay, an amazingly comfortable bed, all amenities you need including wifi and this for a great price just by union square. I think we'd be hard put to find a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location as a base for enjoying the city and nearby Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: tuffmuff
Reviews.Content: Lovely updated hotel with old-time charm. Clean and well kept. Try and get an upper floor for better view and sleep quality. Only disappointment was they did not come through with the free morning limo service into the financial district as stated in their amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: escapeGTA
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel. We got a great special through calling in via the number on the website. For the money I think it would be really hard to do better. The hotel has character and has been renovated to be more comfortable and clean. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, friendly and accommodating. The location cannot be beat, right next to Union Square and anything you may need. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY PLEASANT STAY”
Reviews.Author: gro05
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a wonderful week at the Kensington Park SFO. We originally booked double/double. At check-in was offered upgrade to room with view of Union Sq for minimal extra, which was great. Smallish room, however, the period of the hotel, this is to be expected. Everything extremely clean and well maintained. Decor, fitting the hotel's embiance. The lobby is elegant. I know comments have been made by previous bloggers, about noise (sirens, garbage trucks, etc.) however, when staying in any downtown area, it is to be expected and we soon got use to street noises. Also other comments stated "no fridge in the room" ... you only have to ask and one is given. Breakfast around the corner at Sears ... great. Probably the nicest thing about this boutique hotel... you get to know the staff. The girls on the front desk were wonderful .. always with a smile and ready for a laugh. Great ambassadors to the hotel. The conceirge (Bob) was a wealth of information, enabling us 2 Aussie girls to travel with ease around SFO by BART, bus, ferry or cable-car. Thank you Bob. As we have both travelled extensively over 40 yrs, we know what is good and what is not, so the best endorsement I can give to this hotel ... YES, I will stay at the Kensington Park again .... in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming with lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: klms13
Reviews.Content: This is a great little find in a super location. The room was clean, the bed and bed linen good quality and the bathroom nicely appointed. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place in San Francisco Union Square Area”
Reviews.Author: Dragon210
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel that has all the amenities that a traveler could need.The updated and comfortable rooms feature comtemporary furniture, technology and great beds. Reception staff and housekeeping were freindly, efficient and helpful. Nice touches included free wireless access throughout, iPod/iPhone charging/player in room, coffee and tea service each morning and sherry and tea in the late afternoon. Location by theater district makes getting to most areas of the City an easy walk also one block from Powell Avenue Cablecar line.. A great peaceful and restful place after seeing the sights or attending a conference when compared to the neighboring large chain hotels. The Kensington Place is not to overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Very handy position”
Reviews.Author: Hugh25
Reviews.Content: Only about 50metres from Union Square , which is where the central shops are and the cable car goes through union square down to Fishermans wharf ! The room was on the six floor nice size clean and nicely furnished. No tea and coffee making facilities but they did provide coffee etc from 7am-10am but you had to go to the 9th floor to get it ! It seemed silly as they provided a fridge in the room which had plenty of room on top for an electric kettle and tea /coffee. Staff were friendly and helpful. No breakfast available although Sears dinner which was great was just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “A great option”
Reviews.Author: THDH
Reviews.Content: Kensington Park is a very nice. clean. confortable and convenient hotel. We had a room on the 10th floor that was roomy and well appointed. The location is great, just a block from Union Square. The price is right in San Francisco, where prices generally are high.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Cozy and Warm”
Reviews.Author: JayJayPhoenix_Az
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Francisco for the first time in celebration of our 10 year Wedding Anniversary. Kensington Park is in a great location near shops, restaurants and transportation lines. We reserved a Royal Court King and it was plenty of space for hubby and I. The best part of the hotel are the rooms. I would say the lobby, elevators, and main hallways could use some updating. Upon checkin we were warmly greeted by Jason at the Front Desk who congratulated us on our wedding anniversary. We arrived to the hotel well in advance of the standard checkin time, but had no problem gaining access to our room early. Shortly after entering our room we were surprised with a knock on the door and it was concierge congratulating us with a bottle of red wine, this was a very nice touch! The rest of our stay was quiet and comfortable, which was very much appreciated after long days of site-seeing. The beds were comfortable. Complimentary WiFi, Coffee, OJ, Tea, and Sherry... Value! If you are looking for an experience of San Francisco charm and history, I would recommend Kensington Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Miarocls
Reviews.Content: The reviews I had read of the Kensington Park Hotel on various travel sites were pretty positive. We needed a centrally located hotel in S.F., and found a great rate through Resortime.com. We much prefer boutique hotels for their level of service and value. The Kensington exceeded our expectations in just about every area. We found ourselves arriving (by car) a few hours before check-in time, and thought we'd have to hassle trying to find parking for our car and our bags until then. We phoned ahead from the interstate to ask about an early check-in, and were assured that at least one of our two rooms that we had booked would be made available for early arrival. We were delighted to be greeted pleasantly and were informed that both rooms were ready for us. The Kensington was very clean and comfortable. The beds were amazing! Beautiful linens and comfy mattress, like sleeping on a cloud. The decor was updated and stylish. Evening tea and sherry were available on the lobby. Service was top-notch. Our only disappointment was the absence of an in-room coffeemaker. We will most definitely return, and we will certainly recommend the Kensington Park to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Talk About "Personality!"”
Reviews.Author: bluedog723
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were gifted an overnight stay at this wonderful pearl of a hotel! It's a charming blend of modern and traditional, and sits in a terrific location that lets you spill out into the heartbeat of Union Square. Staff - everyone from the front desk folks to the housekeeping staff -- actually smiled and made it a point to "connect" with us on a personal level. What a nice feeling! We look forward to a next visit without hesitation! They live up to their parent company name -- Personality Hotels! P.S. Loved their fun treatment of the usual written messages one normally finds in a hotel room. Kudos for the creativity!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Wandering Jew
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple nights at this lovely boutique full service hotel one block off Union Square. Old world ambiance....great service..... sophisticated atmosphere, helpful staff. Our room was on the top floor with a full city view. Very romantic setting day and night. Walk to shopping, restaurants, theater. We got this room through their internet site for a song....needing to pay in full at the time the reservation was made. Well worth it! Only negative would be the on site parking which is expensive on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “Coustomer Service is Spot On~ We loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roswatki
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! From the front desk staff to the cleaning staff it showed the employees take pride in this hotel. Anything we needed was taken care of immediately. The room was very nice and the bed, well, best sleep I have had at a hotel in a long while. Perfect stay! Location is central for shopping, ice skating for my 6yo in winter, restaurants, and easy to get to any area of the city via public transportation using cable car or bus. Thanks and we will be back when in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Nice heritage building in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: gold_fish333
Reviews.Content: The room was a little smaller than I'd anticipated, but it was very comfortable. The decor is very in keeping with the age of the building. There's no coffee or tea facilities in the room, but they offer free coffee/ tea/orange juice on 2 designated floors from about 7am to 10am. I found that a little inconvenient because I was still suffering from jet lag and getting up in the morning was tough. I'd wished that they were able to offer that service for a longer period. Otherwise, the location is excellent for getting around, sightseeing, and shopping. The staff were friendly, and the room service was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, extremely helpful and friendly staff, lovely environment”
Reviews.Author: Calckc
Reviews.Content: You just can't beat the location! The staff gave great recommendations on restaurants. The staff was very friendly and really took care of us. The hotel is older but very clean and quaint! The bed extremely comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “The awesome staff and value make this an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bpc_16
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for vacationers or even for biz. The staff is friendly and knowledgable. Dorothy at the front desk is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AJackson44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location if you want to stay near Union Square. The room rates were good given the location. Stayed here both on arrival and departure into San Francisco. The rooms on Post St are a bit noisy (sirens, honking horns) but rooms at the back are quieter. The hotel is decorated in art decor style which gives it character and charm and the beds are very comfortable. The staff were also very helpful and friendly. There is a cafe next door, La Taza, were you can get a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent friendly clean hotel, fantastic location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Gary_wendy
Reviews.Content: We travelled to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. Having arrived we were upgraded as a goodwill gesture for this occasion. Our room was on the 5th floor and we did not have a problem with noise, the cable cars could be heard but just added to the whole experience and did not disturb us. Bob, the concierge is fantastic and has a vast knowledge of San Fransisco. He gave advice on where to eat, places to avoid, where to visit etc. The location is brilliant half a block from union square. Our only tip is to wait for the cable car at Post Street and Powel Street,if you go to the terminus at the square you could wait up to an hour, but we found that the cable cars left half empty and you were guaranteed to get on at the next stops, rather than queuing up. Best ever holiday, hotel fantastic, will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Great small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ABH57
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great mid size hotel right in San Francisco and close to all the main attractions, look no further. This hotel has been a great find for us. We have stayed in the hotel on several occasions, and each time enjoyd our stay at the Kensington Park. The location can not be beat; 1/2 block from Union Square, shopping, cable cars and great restaurants all around. And the staff is attentive and caring. We recently had a travel issue and the staff at the front desk went above and beyond to assist us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place right in the middle of everything.”
Reviews.Author: DonnaCA
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Kensington Park hotel. We had never been to San Francisco before. Our concierge, Bob, was extremely knowledgable about the city and guided us so we experienced as much as possible in our short 4 day stay. We stayed in a corner king room which was nicely appointed. The rooms are small which is pretty typical in a large city where space is at a premium but it was very comfortable. The views from the windows were spectacular on both sides of the corner room. The bed was hands down, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in including my own! You can't beat the location right in the heart of Union Square. We were steps from the cable cars and within walking distance for Chinatown also. There are countless great restaurants within walking distance and the shopping is amazing. We are thinking if we return to the city for a longer stay that we may stay at the Steinhart which is also part of the personality hotel family. (Larger space for a longer stay. The stay there is a minimum of 7 days.) All of the staff were friendly and very attentive to the guests. We would absolutely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, could benefit by offering breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Enthusiast_80
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, close to attractions and stores. I did not found it that noisy as the cable car does not transit on this specific street but you can take it a few steps further on the crossing of Post and Powell. The rooms are cozy and nicely decorated and the bathroom is large. Despite that the service in San Francisco is terrible and disappointing in most of restaurants and stores (you'll get much friendlier and faster service in Paris!) this hotel was the exception to the rule and offered a nice and attentive service all the time. Considering price vs. value and other offerings in the same area, I can say that this hotel is comfy and pretty, and is fairly priced. It offers coffee and tea on the 11th floor in the morning but certaily could benefit of offering a continental breakfast or at least having the tea and coffee on every floor so one doesn't have to be going up and down the stairs just to grab a cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean--nice staff---great location but....noisy”
Reviews.Author: SEGHerndon_VA
Reviews.Content: Found this online---price sounded great for downtown San Francisco ($139/night). Great location--1/2 block from Union Square and a couple of blocks from BART and city transportation. Shopping all around. Staff was very friendly from front desk to maids and maintenance staff. Old building but new furnishings, updated bath and very comfortable bed! No AC but ceiling fan was all we needed. Our ONLY complaint was the street noise. Sirens, bottles breaking (trash being dumped?) and sounds from people celebrating in the street woke us up a lot but maybe that is life in the city! Definately would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary In The City”
Reviews.Author: mikg50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 23rd anniversary this past month and decided to stay at the Kensington Park Hotel. The entire staff were extremely accomodating and welcoming. From check-in to check-out we wanted for nothing. The front desk and concierge were very informative on local restaurants and making our reservations. Oh yes, the complimentary bottle of champagne awaiting us in our room with a hand written note from the general manager was a professional touch! If you are looking for a great hotel in the union square area near everything, The Kensington is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Full of character”
Reviews.Author: neilthestooge
Reviews.Content: Great position and the hotel had a nice cozy, old fashioned charm. Room was a great size and very clean, being near Union Square it is ideal for shopping or getting on the Muni or cable car to get around the rest of the city. No drink facilities in the room was a problem, although hot drinks available only during a small time window. I would definitely suggest it better to stay in the centre rather than Fisherman's Wharf. San Francisco is a great city to visit - plenty to do and see and you won't go much wrong as to choose this hotel for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “best value on union square”
Reviews.Author: mark-lincoln-nebr
Reviews.Content: helpful staff, clean rooms, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location. Cute place!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTraveller34
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place. The location was perfect for starting the Nike Women's Marathon in Union Square, particularly as we were in the slowest 14 min. + group which lined up just out front. Dad sheltered from the cold in the lobby until he saw us coming by. Gloria was very friendly and helpful at checkin and the staff met all my needs. The lobby was quite lovely with high, beamed ceilings decorated with paintings of medieval lords and ladies. The room was nicely appointed with a modern look to the furniture with a large closet and I slept well on the comfy bed. You can hear the Powell Street cable car bell from time to time. It's pretty well situated to local MUNI transit (cable cars and buses). Travellers need to understand that SF hotels are small as many were converted from old office/apartment buildings. There is not much land to go around on this peninsula and things were built close and tight in the old days. Don't expect a sprawling beach resort. Pools and other large fixtures are very rare. I happen to like old buildings, so the fact that the door sill between the room carpet and the hall carpet showed wear just added to the charm for me. The stairwell had a cool brass railing and other old fashioned touches are here and there. There is no AC, but there is a ceiling fan. This goes back to the old building issue and the fact that SF is usually quite cool and AC would be only needed about 2-3 days a year anyway. The walls are not soundproof (building materials were not as advanced back then), and I could hear the neighbors talking, opening/shutting doors, TVs, etc. With that said, I would definitely stay here again because that's what you have to expect in downtown SF. I felt safe there, the rooms were clean and comfy and the location was just right.

Reviews.Title: “good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: rumitummy
Reviews.Content: the location is convenient to transportation and shops, but rooms were very small, but clean. street parking is very hard.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but don't let bed bugs bite”
Reviews.Author: noon28rick
Reviews.Content: stayed here 3 nights in early august, can't beat the location, rooms are nice, but they could update carpet, look old and frayed. we had a corner room, nice view of union square, plus with window open could hear music from free concert on most nights. We really enjoyed our stay, but when i got home, my wife noticed a rash on my arm. When i looked up bedbug bite on wiki, it looked just like my arm. I did notify the hotel, but they said no bedbugs were found (big suprise), if you stay here, make sure you pull the sheets back and look for signs, there is an epidemic going on now. This could happen at any hotel in s.f. it is an international destination, just check your bed b4 unpacking.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Maruchi15
Reviews.Content: My trip was a combination of business and leisure, this is why I found that this hotel was a perfect fit. As soon as I walked in I was pleasantly surprised with the warm and inviting lobby. The employees at the front desk were always helpful and friendly. The room was very comfortable and clean. The best part was the location, right across from were my seminar took place and just a block away from Union Square. The only complaint I might have is that the hotel does not have air conditioning and if you go in a warm spell like I did, the rooms do not have a comfortable temperature during the day. I am very pleased with my stay and would recommend this hotel anytime!!!

Reviews.Title: “Historic charm, updated, clean and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jrsmall
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one block from Union Square and cable car, restaurants and shopping! We walked everywhere and rode the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf and just for fun a few times. The hotel is very well kept, rooms and bathrooms are very clean (my main concern when booking hotels). Lots of historic charm in lobby and rooms with marble in bathrooms, glass shower doors, big closet and complimentary sherry after 4:00pm in the lobby! So relaxing after a busy day. Windows open for cool air and there is a ceiling fan to keep the room airy on warm days. With windows open, you will hear delivery/garbage trucks very early in the morning. Can't escpae that in the city. Flat screen on wall. The ice machine on our floor (6) broke and we had to go the 12th floor for ice. Nice white, clean linens on the bed which was very comfortable...great sleeping. Would recommend to anyone. Front desk staff was always very cordial and helpful for directions, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Budget Conscious Travelers in an Expensive City”
Reviews.Author: MondayAlready
Reviews.Content: I wanted a weekend excursion to San Francisco and didn't want to break my pocket book. It seemed that a week before our departure, even the three plus star hotels were running over $200.00 a night. The day before we left, we booked the Kensington Park Hotel for $180 a night. I guess the hotel releases rooms at a discount rate right before the weekend. In any event, our expectations were that it would be a small hotel that was clean and stylish. It fit the bill. The rooms are on the small side, but because our stay was only two nights we didn't mind. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom clean and upgraded, and the design was modern. The location is fabulously close to Union Square. We didn't try the adjacent restaurant, but noted a lot of eateries close by our hotel. We walked to the pier to catch the ferry to Sausalito (about 15 minutes walking). On our way back, we caught a cable car to Chinatown and walked back to our hotel. We didn't have a car and it was perfect. We rode BART from the airport to the Powell Street exit and easily walked with our carry-on to the hotel. I read a review that said that the guest had an out of date room, so I asked the front desk for a renovated room upon check-in and it seemed to be no problem.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrenchRose
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. 5 mins walk to the Bart Station, 1 minute to the trolley. Lots of beautiful shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel was having building work so we didn't get to see the full exterior although the lobby was pleasant. Quite traditional in style. First impressions of the room were very good - A good size, well furnished with a stunning blend of classic modern and traditional furniture & decor. Small but sufficient sized bathroom. All very clean & comfortable. There was a note in the room advising us to keep the window closed during our stay as there was building work being undertaken throughout the hotel. There was no air-con but a fan above the bed which we sometimes struggled to use without the light being on so this was a bit problematic at times & we did get very hot. Unfortunately the note failed to add that we should not open our curtains either as there would be workmen standing 2 feet away on the other side of the window on the ledge which I can assure you was a huge shock on our first morning. I really didn't feel that it was acceptable to offer this room to guests where there wouldn't be any natural light (I would run to the window in the hall in my pjs to check the weather!) and we could hear every conversation by the builders very clearly. In hindsight, we should have requested another room/complained but we were so exhausted after a flight from the UK that we were just happy to have a comfy bed and wanted to relax but I guess that's the British in us! I would definitely considor this hotel again as overall we had a great stay but I would probably check that the building work had finished first.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Modern, Clean - a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: DustMonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of a Californian driving trip, and were truly sad to leave. The hotel was in an excellent location, right next to Union square, and as we had requested a quiet room, we were placed right on the top floor facing the back (which incidentally is where the view is...). We arrived absolutely shattered from 12 hours of flying, and were delighted to find a bottle of wine complements of the management to celebrate our engagement. The bed was one of the most comfortable of our trip, and led to a fantastic night's sleep, even with jet lag. The whole place was modern, but with quaint touches, and the reception area really must be seen to be fully appreciated! The staff were very helpful and pleasant, and seemed genuinely interested in making sure we were comfortable. Don't worry about breakfast - the Honey Crepe and Creamery is just a block away, and is a wonderful introduction to what the rest of the world seems to think America eats for breakfast (eg, mountains of pancakes and powdered sugar over everything). Would definitely recommend a stay here, just don't make the same mistake I did, and only find out about the morning coffee service (a station on every other floor) on the last day!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and convenient”
Reviews.Author: runner21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this beautiful place in the heart of Post st. with close access to Chinatown and nearby restaurants; the atmosphere was quiet and relaxing,the room was cozy and up on the 12th floor with a nice view; the kids loved it so did I. If you are looking for a hotel to completely rest and get around in no time, this is it; the only down side was that the elevator(s) was a bit busy that night, probably because there were a lot of people staying in, on the other hand the elevator has a sofa bench that can be used as a bed for the 10-30 sec ride to your floor; I thought it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Old time San Francisco ambience with modern conveniences”
Reviews.Author: LisaRomao
Reviews.Content: My daughters were amazed by the "fanciness" of the hotel as they called it. It was very relaxing, very comfortable and clean. It has the feeling of a 1930s or 40s hotel that Hollywood movie stars would stay at. Loved it and looking forward to our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Helena8888
Reviews.Content: Booked what seem a good hotel on-line, was very disspointed. We check in to a King Court double double for 3 nights. On our first night our fan would only work with the light on, there seem do be a cord missing from the fan. There was no air conditioning so it was very stuffy and we could not sleep, we opened the window (opened a small amount) but found we could not close this in the morning, was worried about leaving the room like this as there was work men on a cradle outside and for the entire time we spend there. We told the person on the front desk about the problem with the fan and the window we could not close. She asked if we would wait to see if this could be fixed. She returned to say the window was now closed but we need to wait to see if the fan could be fixed. We found the staff unhelpful. We had to pop back at 2pm to check and see if we needed to repack our luggage for this to be moved to another room. This was the case and we had to pack all our stuff and moved to the same room on the next floor. We ended up wasting a day when we had stuff planned. This proved to have different problems, like the fan worked but no light (because we had the corner rooms - these were dark) the shower taps were fitted wrongly, so was hard to work out, the fridge was making a humming sound. We only had one more night to go so we could not be bother to complain. then the electricity went down for an afternoon, this meant that there was no water available to wash your hands or even to flush the toliet.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great stay at the Kensington”
Reviews.Author: cablecar8
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two years ago and just stayed there again. You just can't beat it at any price. Great location, great staff, great room and reasonable rates------------------stay in the corner room with a view-----just a little more expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay here when you can stay in a far better hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Eat_out_often
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Kensington Park Hotel and were completely disappointed. We booked a Royal Court double double at $249/night. I noticed on this site that others paid far less than this and I'm not sure where they found their deals...hmmm. Nevertheless, they unexpectedly "upgraded" us to a Deluxe double double when we got there. Oh goody! Except that the room was on a lower floor with less expensive rooms and without the amenities that were promised. It was a corner unit (I suppose to make up for the inferior room). The furnishings were well worn, large scratches on the walls and furnishings and the carpet was dirty. I can overlook some things but the bathroom really put us over the top; it was dated, dingy, and poorly finished with a moldy shower! The next morning I complained to the front desk clerk who was not able to tell me the amenities offered for their better rooms (amenities that we paid for), compared to the Deluxe rooms. I spoke with the manager who admitted that we were placed in an inferior room, that they were completely full the previous night, and that we should be happy because the room had 2 windows! We booked this reservation 3 months ago when they had many rooms available. Why should we suffer because the hotel filled up?? After much discussion, she reluctantly took $30 off the bill. We will never stay here again. We stay in SF frequently and ALWAYS try to book at one of the Kimpton Hotels. This time we were unable to to find a room at one of our favorites (not sure why), the Hotel Monaco. They have far better rooms with wonderful amenities and very professional staff. We didn't find this to be true at the Kensington Park. A word of caution. Be sure to look at the room before agreeing to inhabit it.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: JuliaClaire
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to San Fran and I wanted to find a clean, updated hotel near Union Square for under $200/night. Kensington Park was step away from everything. It has been renovated and if you are looking for a great location, clean updated room and comfortable beds -- you can stop searching and just book this place!! There's no breakfast but you don't need it as there is a cute coffee shop two doors away that makes amazing omelettes. Spend a few extra $ to secure a room on a higher floor, it made a big difference at night to block out the city sound.

Reviews.Title: “It's All About The Location!”
Reviews.Author: stripey2000
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel located right in the heart of the city on Post Street, steps from Union Square. It’s a boutique style hotel with gorgeous rooms and super comfy beds. The bathroom was a little dated but clean and functional. The room at the front of the hotel which my wife and i were given didn’t have much of a view but we really didn’t care as we spent as little time as possible in the hotel and as much time as possible out and about in the city. Due to a little bit of Post Street noise very early on a morning, i did find myself waking up briefly a couple of times, but due to the location it’s just something that can’t be helped – besides, it really didn’t bother us and soon went back to sleep until the alarm went off! It’s a fantastic old building with loads of charm and original features, and the lobby is small but still manages to be quite grand. The hotel offers free use of their internet using the PC’s in the business centre for those travelling without laptops. Also there is free tea and coffee available early in the mornings at certain areas in the hotel. Try the Pinecrest Diner close to the hotel for breakfast. My wife and i tried loads of breakfast places in the surrounding area and found the Pinecrest to be the best place (open 24hrs). If you happen go to a place called Lori's Diner (a 50's themed joint), don’t go to the one up the stairs opposite H&M - make sure you go to the other branch which is very close to the Pinecrest Diner on Mason Street (at Geary). This one was far superior! Alsobe sure to have a drink at the Clock Bar located in the lobby of the Westin St Francis hotel across the street. It's a bit posh and quite pricey but a great little bar with a really nice atmosphere. Overall, The Kensington Park Hotel is a fab hotel set in an even better location which is perfect to see all of the San Francisco sights, and i’d certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend spot in the heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: whatupdude
Reviews.Content: If you want value and location, this is the place. The rooms were clean. The location is one of the best. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm - great service”
Reviews.Author: chinsb
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in June based on friend's recommendation. Hotel has old world charm that is well maintained. Union Sq location is convenient, and the price was very reasonable. Hotel staff was very helpful, from concierge to clerk to maintenance staff. The only minor things I didn't like were the small beds (2 full size for 3 of us) and the afternoon self "tea/sherry" service. Should provide some munchies or cookies. Sherry tasted like medicine, and the milk for the tea was curdled one day...

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Comfort & Service”
Reviews.Author: bbtime49
Reviews.Content: Extremely comfortable, pleasantly decorated rooms at a surprisingly good price. Situated in an excellent central location for visiting the restaurants, shops, and attractions of San Francisco. Courteous, friendly staff was always in attendance and full of very helpful information for getting to activities and selecting great restaurants to suit our preferences.

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: talljoeartist
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews, location, and price. I stayed June 27 thru July 5th. By the time I left, the place had become a Jerry Springer episode with some guy on my floor banging on the door to his or his ''girlfriend's'' room saying, ''come on baby, open da door.... come on baby open da door and lemme in", over and over and over. Then it would stop and then start again. I called the front desk about it and they said, "We'll send someone to your room." I told them my room wasn't the problem. The walls and windows at this hotel are so thin you hear everything in the room next to you and all the street noise below which goes on ALL night. There was constant pounding somewhere in or adjacent to the hotel for what seemed endless early one morning while sleeping. In addition, doors to adjacent rooms were constantly being slammed, and I don't mean once, I mean over and over and over as if the door wasn't shutting properly. This happened at all hours along with parents arguing and children yelling. The bedding was very poor and worn-out. Don't stay here if you have allergies! Free wireless internet was slow and completely down late July 3rd into the evening of July 4th. On the plus side, the hotel is in a convenient location and the staff were helpful and pleasant most of the time. The room description said there would be a mini-bar or frig. This was not true so I asked for one only because I have medication that needs refrigeration. The staff was good enough to put a small frig in my room although it was not very cold. I'm glad others find this hotel satisfactory but I will not stay at this hotel again next time I'm in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravellers75
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel with lots of charm. The furnishings were beautiful and different to most other hotels we have stayed at - including a couch in the elevators!! It was in a very convenient location - close to Union Square and the cable cars. All in all a great stay in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bridger01
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a lot of charm. The rooms were a little small, but had a lot of character. The staff was amazing, and could not have been anymore helpful! The staff gave great advice on restaurants and great tips for getting around. The hotel is in a great location, there is so much to see, we walked all over the place. Loved this hotel, wish we could have stayed a little longer in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location in an older but well-kept hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wahoo1990
Reviews.Content: First off, the price was great at $135 on hotels.com. Second, the location was perfect -- a block from Powell Street and Union Sq., and within short walk of BART station, the Powell line cable car turn around, and muni bus lines. We drove up from So. Cal. in a rental car. Instead of paying to keep it and park it in S.F., we dropped our bags at the hotel, returned the car to the airport and found it an easy trip back on the BART to our hotel. We were also close enough to walk to Chinatown and felt very safe doing so at night with our children. The hotel lobby was very nice. The staff well-trained and gave great service. The room was on the small side. With 2 double beds and a desk and dresser, the room was too full to comfortably put a suitcase on the floor without having to step over it to get around. The closet was very small as well. Luckily, the bathroom was a decent size and we could put one of our small suitcases in there. Bathroom was clean and shower was fine, but not the greatest water pressure. The beds were very comfortable with nice linens and duvets. Decor was also very pleasing and updated. Our room did not have a ceiling fan, and as some other reviewers pointed out -- was a bit stuffy -- even in March -- with no A/C. However, we did open our window (and put the kids in the bed that was not next to the window) and the staff also provided us with a small tabletop fan that worked quite well. The hotel was quiet and we had a good night's sleep. Overall, I was happy with our accomodations. I liked the uniqueness of the boutique hotel. The quality was good, and the price was great. I think older hotels with small rooms is fairly common in big cities. I wouldn't hesitate to stay in the Kensington Park hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at Best - Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: Bon_voyage79
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights this past weekend and booked our stay as part of a lastminutetravel.com package, paying close to rack rate. Our stay was not pleasant. It wasn’t exceedingly awful, but a multitude of small things made it not enjoyable. The hotel is adequate at best. I honestly wouldn’t suggest paying more than $50/night. We arrived at the hotel on a Friday morning and wanted to drop off our bags. We didn’t expect to be able to check in right away. The desk clerk told us that our room wasn’t ready, but there was a much nicer room with a king bed and a view that was ready. Oh goody, we thought, we’re going to get upgraded! And she said that we could have it for $20 more per night. We declined. Not the best way to start the trip. I didn’t expect to be able to check in right away, but I really didn’t expect the tricky up-sell. She asked for our voucher. What voucher, we asked? She had our reservations, but still insisted that we give her a voucher from lastminutetravel.com. This company does not send vouchers. Arghh… so she took a copy of our email confirmation instead. She suggested that we come back after one and perhaps a room would be ready then. We dropped our luggage and returned at close to two. When we came back, our room was ready, and we asked for our luggage. There was now a different desk clerk, and she went to get our luggage and then returned and said that somebody would bring it up to our room. Um…no that’s okay, we’ll take our luggage now. As you can see, we are thrifty travelers, and did not want to be obligated to tip somebody for bringing up our two carry-ons that we are perfectly capable of bringing up ourselves. The desk clerk was not pleased, and visibly scowled. She went back into the luggage room and continued to search for our luggage. Apparently, she couldn’t find it, which was why she said somebody would bring it to our room. Finally with the help of (the concierge?), she was able to locate our luggage. We were on the leper floor with some sort of Elks facility and a business center. Our room was fine, but nothing nice. Here are some things we noticed about the room: * The bed sheets are ancient and thread-bare. There is a little sign next to the bed encouraging you to not get your sheets changed. I’ve seen these before and I’ve not been particularly perturbed, but this one was especially scolding, saying, in all caps, MAKE THE DECISION FOR YOURSELF. *There is no air conditioning, and the ceiling fan rattles if you put it above the lowest setting. *There is a lot of street noise, especially drunk people at night. *There is no shower cap. *The toilet paper is very thin. *There were stray hairs in the bathroom. *There are very few television channels. Here are some things we noticed about the hotel: *The elevator certificate has been expired for over a year. *Décor is sloppy and crookedly placed. Not a big deal, but there is a clear inattention to detail. *Front desk clerks are ignorant at best, and willful liars at worst. Along with our check-in experience, we talked to the front desk regarding shuttles to Oakland Airport. I was told that it would cost the same amount to take a taxi with the hotel’s preferred company as it would to take a shuttle. It’s actually 30% more. They were no help in finding airport transportation. All and all, not a pleasant stay. It just wasn’t comfortable, and it sure didn’t feel special. You can do A LOT better for your money. I will not be going back to Kensington Park or any of the Personality Hotels. I’ll stick to Kimptons and the Nikko from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Mohsman
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the many positive reviews in TripAdvisor and am conflicted about how to rate this hotel My prejudice is to stay at 4-5 star hotels when possible. These were so expensive in SF that we tried the Kensington Park. So here are the pros and cons. Pros: Less expensive, very friendly staff, superb location near Union Square, decent rooms, relatively inexpensive valet parking, great coffee and juice bar in morning, cool benches in the elevators Cons: Lobby, hallways, and rooms a bit run down, street side rooms very noisy – especially at night (beware if you are a light sleeper), VERY small closet, inadequate air conditioning, door locks VERY noisy when closing – so whenever any nearly door closes there is a very loud clanking sound (beware if you are a light sleeper - our neighbor came "home" at 2 AM both nights, going in and out twice), Inattentive valets – they were not there most of the time, average wait of 15-20 minutes for your car to be brought by valet. So you decide. Not plush but adequate and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - fantastic location - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sandra_Flanagan
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best value for money hotels we stayed in whilst in California. The location is fantastic - you really couldn't be closer to the centre of things but our room was still quiet, being at the back of the hotel. I suppose the price you pay for that is that you don't get a view but we use the room just for sleeping and are out and about from dawn til dusk. We also don't believe in paying over the odds for fancy hotels either so this fit the bill perfectly, being of a good standard but at a reasonable price. We had a large family group taking 3 rooms and all rooms were just like the photos on their website, quite small but not cramped in any way and our room had just 1 bed. We got a great price - 4 nights for the price of 3. Free internet access (a rare thing in California where we paid $15 per day in Las Vegas and $10 in San Diego) plus tea/coffee/sherry between 4-6pm - great small touches that make a difference. No food in the hotel but that's not a problem - try some of the diners within a couple of minutes walk - O'Doull's Irish Bar or Sears Diner - brilliant breakfasts and great staff. Bob, the concierge in the hotel was extremely pleasant and helpful - he really couldn't do enough to help with restaurant recommendations, taxi bookings etc. Thoroughly nice guy and helped make our stay one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: groverGirl23
Reviews.Content: After much research I chose Kensington Park for a little brides getaway and boy was I impressed! We arrived at 9am to find our room all ready for us(which is nice coming off a 4 hour drive!) The desk clerk was extremely nice. The room was on the small side but I think everything in San Francisco is :) The decor was excellent the bathroom was very spacious. We had a royal court double double that had a view of Nob Hill which was gorgeous at sunrise. The beds were EXTREMELY comfortable! I wish I had one at home! The robe and slippers made it a bit more luxurious...nice touch! The high light was when my gal pals and I went exploring the city when we returned there was a comp bottle of wine and a sweet letter from the front desk with a congrats on our upcoming weddings! That did it for me I was smitten by that. The hotel is in a VERY good location close to everything! We went to the Drake Hotel to dance(which is just around the corner) up on the 22nd floor which how many people can say they've done that! I can't wait to bring my soon to be husband here and show him why I fell in love with Kensington Park! Thanks everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Initial disappointment changed to very high regard!”
Reviews.Author: Bee46
Reviews.Content: After a tiring coach trip from Monterey we were disappointed to find that the ' very nice room ' reserved for my sister and I would not be available until the next day. We had booked a Royal Court double double to ensure we had two beds and because they are on the top two floors - we had also requested a quiet room overlooking Nob Hill. All this had been booked six months previously. However we moved next day and were pleased to be in a quiet, slightly larger room (none of the two bedded rooms are very large) with a very pleasant view across Nob Hill. Bathroom was immaculate and beds extremely comfortable, but some of the room fittings were a bit tired and dated. Unfortunately we were opposite the Royal Suite and on Saturday there was a function in there. We were woken at around midnight, and kept awake until 2.30am, by the revellers across the hall. We (and others) complained to reception and we did hear someone ask the party to keep the volume down. It would have been nice to have been forewarned though - especially after our initial inconvenience of having to move rooms. But as our stay progressed we began to appreciate staying in a small boutique hotel. The staff were excellent, particularly Dorothy, Gloria, Joshua on reception and Bob the concierge. They really make the place. My sister went home to Australia as booked but I was stranded by the ash cloud. The hotel moved me to a one bedded room and kindly reduced the room rate for me. I was stuck on my own, uncertain of when I would get a flight back to the UK. The staff were most sympathetic and I was so glad to be in the Kensington Park, rather than an impersonal 400 bed hotel. It was a very stressful situation and I cannot praise the staff highly enough for their kindness towards me. The earlier problems faded into insignificance. The situation of the hotel could not be better either - just a few minutes walk to the Square, cable cars and restaurants. Free access to the internet was a plus - especially when the volcano erupted and I needed to contact family and airline. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeskahl
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. The rooms and bathrooms were quite small. The bed was very comfortable and had nice sheets, bedding and pillows. Our room had a large flat screen tv and nice furniture. We did not use any of the other amenities of the hotel. The front desk staff was not very helpful and check-in took longer than one would expect. It was a bit expensive for the space. Otherwise it was in a great location with easy access to everything we needed to do. We walked down to the Wharf to eat at Boudins Bakery... don't skip this place! Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a comfortable room in a good location and are willing to spend some extra money for the location.

Reviews.Title: “This is on my list of top 5 hotels in which I have stayed”
Reviews.Author: drawjojo
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable feel to this hotel and the staff is wonderful. Beautiful decor.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: SmudgeandPid
Reviews.Content: Top hotel, would certainly recommend it to others, great team of staff, great rooms, wonderful setting and the location couldn't have been better, literally a few steps from Union square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKevin07
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant 4 day stay in one of the best located hotels in the City. Considering the very cheap rate we paid it would be hard to offer many crticisms. The staff were always helpful - in particular Bob the concierge gave great advice for tours and places to eat. Nearby cafes provided close access and affordable meals - La Taza in particular also provided great latino pop music as a soundtrack to the multi cultural city that is San Fran. The rooms were spacious but a little dated though clean. we had a room overlooking Post Street and as a couple of previous reviews have noted , noise can be a problem. Garbage collection in particular from the premises opposite was a problem around 11pm. We were tired after a 4 week trip and probably could have slept through a rock concert but I would suggest that a room at the rear of the hotel would be a far better option for any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely classy hotel with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: dscgolf
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding for which the reception was across the street at the St. Francis and chose the Kengington Park becuase of its higher reviews and it seemed to be more dog friendly. In fact, it turned out to be probably the most dog friendly of many hotels where we've stayed with the little fella, not in terms of amenities (no dog bowels, blankets, etc., but who really needs them) but insofar as how the staff acted toward him. Which gives rise to the next highpoint-outstanding service. We decided we didn't need /want full housekeeping service on the second day of our stay but did want the garbage emptied. The staff was on the scene within two minutes of our request. Front desk staff politely greeted us by name upon entering and exiting. The decor of the hotel is just as subtly classy as the service. Complimentary juice and coffee are served in the morning and sherry and tea in the afternoon. Some light snacks with the latter-nuts, etc., would be a nice touch. Room service is from a deli (La Taza) two doors down and stops at 7 with what is basically a lunch menu. We just went there and got take out for breakfast (opt for the fruit rather than the burned potatoes) to avoid the service charges. There's another deli (Cafe Encore) two doors down that's open until 8 and has a broader selection of sandwiches and salads that can suffice for dinner but a less appealing breakfast menu. The Farallon, a highly regarded restaurant, is part of the hotel, so it's hard to understand why they don't have room service from it at least for dinner. The room was fine (nice decor, great TV, comfortable beds) but quite cramped for two people and a dog, including a small bathroom. The low speed internet access was adequate for our purposes; higher speed connections are available for a fee. The room was supposed to be one class up from the base (it was about fifteen bucks more per night), but in fact the only difference is you're on a higher floor "with a view of Nob Hill or Union Square." Our "view" of the latter was the side of the new tower of the St. Francis. There is a well functioning ceiling fan but no a/c and the window lacked a screen. It was in the low 70s the day we left and you could tell by 11:30 that with the sun coming in through the window (unless you drew the shades) there was going to come a point when the room would get stuffy. As a native northern Californian, I can attest, it can and does get into the 80s several times a year in SF and even the 90s an handful of times. I would suggest checking the 10 day forecast if planning to stay there any time from April through October and if there's a chance of such temps, changing to a hotel with a/c. Noise from Post St. was a real problem; up to 1:30 am on Sunday morning, partiers literally screaming and many sirens. I would imagine that's a problem anywhere you stay in the Union Sq. area. All in all, a very positive experience at quite a reasonable price for that part of SF (around $130 per night through the hotel's web site, booked over a month in advance).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mrfd1979
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, in good location for exploring SF, right by Union Square, ideal for Trams, Cable Car, Buses, Muni and Bart (at Powell Street). Beware of traffic noise - request a room at the back of the hotel, because the ones on the main street are simply too noisy! We managed to move & got upgraded in the process. Slightly odd smell and draft in room, but otherwise nice decor and good size. Disappointing to have no breakfast, but lots of cafes / diners nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: suemacqueen
Reviews.Content: I had 2 nights at Kensington for a short - first time trip to SF. Location was perfect - half block from cable car and Union Square with all its major department stores and boutique shopping. Having arrived from several nights in Vegas staying in very spacious modern hotel room, our equivalent room (double twin) at Kensington was relatively smaller but it had everything we needed. Clean comfortable rooms, largish bathroom, tea/coffee facilities and fridge. Beds very comfortable. Yes it's a little older but our decor was beautiful. It has a warmth about it other hotels often lack. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: HtownNorCal
Reviews.Content: -Great location in Union Square, walking distance to so many great places -Tastefully decorated rooms, feels modern and comfortable -Amazingly cozy beds -Friendly staff with great advice on fun things to do

Reviews.Title: “Old in parts,great location,but noisey due traffic”
Reviews.Author: courtod
Reviews.Content: Great Location for this hotel. Old looking interior but quality of bedding and furniture new. Bathrooms not modern, but very clean. We asked for a Queen size bed, but bed small like a UK double and very uncomfortable as mattress very very soft, it killed both our backs with either small pillows which were too hard. We were overlooking Post Street and traffic noise was quite bad and midnight boy do you hear the bins being emptied. I feel the windows needed double glazing as they are old metal sash windows.Reception staff very helpful plus they have sherry and coffee between 5pm and 7pm

Reviews.Title: “You Cannot Go Wrong at Kensington Park”
Reviews.Author: Enachi
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for both business and pleasure and prefer the boutique hotel whenever possible, as I like my surroundings to feel like the city I am in. Kensington Park does just that - and at a fantastic rate. The Union Square location puts you in the heart of downtown. The rooms are spacious, updated and very tastefully designed. The entire hotel is sparkling clean and the service is excellent and very friendly. It is not loaded with amenities, such as on-site fitness center or restaurant, however, there is a complimentary fitness center at a neighboring property and some of the best restaurants in the city within 100 feet. To top it off, I had the pleasure (guilty?) of knowing that my colleagues paid 3X what I paid for equivalent rooms at some of the high-end chains in the area, The only negatives are very slow internet service and low water pressure in the shower, but that is standard fare in most older buildings in all cities. Finally, the entire staff was very friendly, however, if you are lucky enough to catch him, say hello to Thai! He is Mr. Do-it-All at the hotel and will bring a smile to your face, even on the worst day. The Personality Group is lucky to have a person like that representing their brand.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful gem in the heart of town.......(:”
Reviews.Author: orchid33
Reviews.Content: Went to a convention with my daughter, found this hotel on this site and it truly lived up to and exceeded my expections........wonderful locale, staff friendly, central to everything, clean, great view and had all the charm of an old hotel with the advantages of modernization! I imagine it would be great for a romantic getaway! Was here with family on a mix of business and pleasure......... I thought that this was the best choice for me given the reviews of the"Personality" hotels in San Fran........ Stay here, they value your feedback, make an effort to make you feel at home and most especially valued as a customer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: na88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location-1/2 block from a cable car stop and a couple of blocks from a BART station. The room looked exactly like the room pictured on their website. My room was on the 8th floor and on the street-side. My room was quiet and pleasant. The bed was comfortable. Every staff member, from the cleaning staff to the front desk staff, was very nice and helpful. This was my first trip to San Francisco and the staff answered all my questions about the city. It doesn't have all the amenities of a large hotel like a pool or spa, but the pleasant atmosphere, friendly staff and comfortable room makes this a hotel well worth the money. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Union Square Location”
Reviews.Author: so_traveller
Reviews.Content: Location: The location of this hotel is great, smack in the Union Square area. Service: Generally good, nothing outstanding, but nothing unprofessional either. Besides checking in/out, we didn't really deal with the front desk or concierge. The cleaning service person was very friendly. Food: Did not eat. Gym/Pool: I don't believe they have a gym. But 24 Hour Fitness is within 10 minutes walk. Room: Nice. The room was larger than I feared for a "boutique-type" hotel. The shower door was wonky but not a major nuisance. The wifi availability is good. Overall, nice hotel in great location. I would recommend the hotel if the rate is good compare to other hotels around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money! surprised and happy”
Reviews.Author: WaOzabout
Reviews.Content: booked online, one of the more reasonably priced small hotels near union sq, so weren't expecting much. Were surprised to encounter a large marble lobby, Free brandy in the evenings and tea in the mornings. The hotel has Valet Parking, a THeatre and a Ballroom inside! rooms are very tasteful, in an old regal fashion, nice modern but old fashioned (tasteful) bathrooms! Great shower, comfy bed, big satellite tv. 1 min walk to union square!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Beds! really good location”
Reviews.Author: TanyaA1
Reviews.Content: we booked a double double room (no that isn't an error!) and were not sure what this meant. we were pleasently surprised we had 2 matresses on each bed...like the princess in the pea!! the room was big enough for the 2 of us and the beds were just amazing. we stayed on the 9th floor and had a great view of San Fran. the hotel is right next to Union Square and in the perfect spot to see all the sights, do some shopping and visit china town. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wow wot a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: midas7908
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend spent 9 wonderful nights in this hotel and i must say it was one of the best hotels i have every been in.Very close to union square and the view we had from the 10th floor was beautiful staff was very friendly and will try and cater to ur every need. Room was very clear and neat and the bed is so big and soft and the comfort level is to die for and the coffee maker is so fast.Tea and sherry in the afternoon in the lobby is great after long days out.The only problem we had was a leak in the bathroom and this was sorted pretty quickly.Resturants and diners are a stones throw away and the food is great if it,s shopping u want designer stores and maceys are just on the square.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely divine hotel- class all the way”
Reviews.Author: alijarro1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week, returning this morning. I repeatedly said that I couldn't fault the hotel. We both agree that it was amazing value for money and the location - just steps to Union Square - simply couldn't be bettered. The decor was stunning and I was very sad when it came time to check out! Very accommodating staff and lovely little touches such as the afternoon sherry, and complimentary morning coffee. A very chic experience. We would not hesitate to stay here again when next we are in San Francisco. THANKS KENSINGTON PARK! :-) 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Wajcn50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on our first trip to San Francisco. We were in the front on the 9th floor. There was quite a bit of road noise in the early hours from trash lorries, but after the 1'st night we closed the window and put the fan on and all was OK. Room was very clean and bed comfortable and the location perfect as close to many restaurants and cable cars. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: parkiedee
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel. The rooms looked newly re-done with very modern and plush decor. It was surprisingly very quiet for being right near Union Square. The only complaint was the hotel parking fees were very expensive. The staff was very helpful and professional. Very clean. Would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: sandrakKilkenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kensington Park as part of our honeymoon & were upgraded to the Royal Suite where we had a fab room with a great view. After travelling from L.A. it was a refreshing change to be close to all amenities. The hotel is just off Union Square & is a great location for catching tour buses & is in walking distance to the shopping areas, restaurants & night life. Only regret is that we didn't stay longer! Lovely hotel & would like to give a special mention to the very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Julianna23
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, close to transport and Union Square. As mentioned by other reviewers, this is an older hotel which adds to the charm. Rooms are small but have been modernised and are very inviting. Bathroom is very small and there's no real bench space, but this is only a minor inconvenience. Some have mentioned the street noise can be annoying - we did hear sirens etc but with the window closed, it wasn't an issue. We took the train from the airport and walked the three blocks up to the hotel. It wasn't that far, but if you have lots of luggage, might be a bit of a struggle. Check-in was quick and hassle-free. Seemed like a good area and we felt comfortable walking around. The restaurant looked next to the hotel looked very nice but we didn't have a chance to go. There's also a little cafe on the other side of the hotel which we had breakfast at one morning, which was ok but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: InItinere
Reviews.Content: We consider ourselves very lucky in finding this hotel. Its location is superb, in short walking distance from Union Square. The hotel is charming, and our room was spacious, clean, I would even say luxurious. On the minus side, there is no breakfast included, but you will not find any trouble in finding a nice place for having breakfast in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rubyesq2000
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay. Its not super modern. Its not new. But it was clean and the room looked just like the picture on the internet. The location is perfect. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sweetie1975
Reviews.Content: The Kensington Park is a great hotel if you are after a good location in SF close to shops, restaurants and transport. We caught the BART from the airport to Powell Street then its just a few blocks walk up to the Kensington. Vincent on the front desk was very friendly and welcoming on our arrival. There is no tea/coffee in the rooms but these are available on the 9th floor and you can use the takeaway cups if you wish. Our room was a reasonable size - slightly noisy but then this is a central hotel! Very clean, comfortable bed. One small thing I would say is that it seemed difficult to shut the doors without force ... and noise! We struggled and think next door did too, hence being woken up on a couple of occasions. We got the tour bus on a 2 day pass from Union Square for $20 each and with this you can get on and off as many times as you like. David our driver was hilarious - a fantastic guide with some great stories to tell. If you want a reasonably priced hotel in the heart of it all then the Kensington Park is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service I have enjoyed in a long time”
Reviews.Author: 87Alfa
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights on vacation with spouse, daughter and mother-in-law. Had requested two adjoining rooms so as to be able to assist 91 year old family member. I had neglected to request separate beds for daughter/mother-in-law. Desk clerk, on her own, saw the reserved room only had one bed and asked us if we would prefer separate beds. She not only found new rooms, but moved us up to the top floor so we could get a better view and be on the quiet side of the building. She was extremely cheerful, helpful, proactive in asking if we needed any help/info/reservations/ etc. In fact, all the desk clerks and the conciere were extremely friendly, helpful and genuinely interested in providing any help they could. We used a muni pass to navigate around and several times asked the desk staff for help...they went online to research the bus routes/connections which was very helpful and appreciated. ALL the housekeepers greeted us with a smile and "good morning/ good evening." Kudos to management for assembling and training an excellent staff! Afternoon sherry was a nice touch. Rooms were not fancy but clean, quiet and with very comfortable beds. Free internet and nice business office with printers. Location was only 1/2 block from Union Square-close to mulitple muni transportation alternatives. We visit SF every two years or so. Next time we will going back to the Kensington Park.

Reviews.Title: “Small quality hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: crashLongIslandNy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on the older side, which added to it's charm. The service was first class and friendly. The staff seemed attentive to all of our needs. Tea & sherry in the lobby every afternoon was a nice touch. On the down side , no AC, but we definatly did not need it. There was a big ceiling fan and the window opened. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: montreality
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation package to SF from Montreal via Yahoo travel. We decided on the Kensington Park Hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor and price comparisons. The Kensington Park Hotel is value for money considering its rooms are comfortable and clean, and the fact that it's in the middle of all the action. Actually, we were surprised that the rate was so affordable. The staff were friendly and helpful, the bed was very comfortable, and the room was clean (I paid special notice to the bathroom because I'm finicky about these things). It's true there is no air conditioning (there is a ceiling fan), but we didn't need it anyway during our stay as the weather was cool. I had read some reviews complaining about street noise, but we experienced no problems in this department. Before traveling, I requested a king size bed and/or a room on an upper floor if possible, and they were able to accommodate us with both things. We were not disturbed by outside noise on the 9th floor. All in all, for an expensive city that was full of tourists at the time, we felt we got a great deal at this hotel, and I'll likely stay there again the next time I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chattykathy2
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Kensington Park after reviewing trip advisor and researching different rates and availability at various hotels. It was a great decision as the location of this hotel was perfect for everything we wanted to do. It was situated just off Union Square; the hub of all activity in downtown San Fran. The cable car stop was just at the end of the block and there was many restaurants, coffee shops nearby to get a meal or a quick snack. This boutique hotel was a perfect size , not too big where you feel like just another guest. The staff were very friendly and quick to answer our questions and be very helpful. The concierge was not as friendly and I found it easier to ask the staff questions. Our room was very comfortable and nicely decorated. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel value & prime location.”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelBugs
Reviews.Content: Kensington Park was a terrific boutique hotel and was very conveniently located in proximity to restaurants, shopping and cable cars. The hotel did not have air conditioning (not uncommon in San Francisco), but there was only 1 day where it was warm enough to be an issue. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Location is just great!”
Reviews.Author: Mabeltw
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are friendly and I just love the location which is just around the corner of Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel. OK service. Great location. No repeat visit from us though.”
Reviews.Author: mrsocMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The front desk service was fine however on the 2 occassions we asked concierge for assistance, we were treated rudely and dismissively. In fact I found the concierge treatment quite upsetting. 1 query was about Alcatraz tours and we were rudely told "they are all sold out" and no further effort was made to suggest an alternative. The second query, I asked where a certain street was and the guy looked at me and said "I have no idea what you are talking about" . Just so rude. It's a shame the helpful front desk staff can't also do the concierge work. Rooms are exactly as pictured and described but many parts of the hotel ie) hallways, show signs of wear and tear. On a few occassions we were waiting for ages for lifts as they were being used by maintencance staff. There was just something not right about this place, we couldn't put our finger on it. It's like a mediocre hotel pretending to be exclusive. Don't get a street side room - very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: HAPATRAVELER80
Reviews.Content: This was my brothers and I first trip to San Francisco and we stayed at the Kensington Park for one week. I have to agree totally with the other posts that the service given by the staff was always very attentive and friendly. We stayed in room # 46, eight floor, two double beds was really nice and clean. Nice cafe right next to the hotel called Cafe Taza for a quick breakfast or other meal. Hotel is only about 4 blocks North of the Powell St. Muni & BART station which is great if your using the BART from San Francisco Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: miss_emc
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are simply beautiful! The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever stayed in (other than my own) and the decor is beautiful. Everything from the huge flat screen tv, king size bed, cute bathroom, spacious closet and storage space was perfect. The heating was also great in the cool weather. I guess my only (tiny) gripes were the pressure of the shower head being really weak, and the lack of bar fridge (although there was an ice facility close by). The location was fantastic, being only a 5 minute walk from Macy's Union Square and 10 minutes from the Westfield Shopping Mall. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone considering a stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “All round pleasurable trip”
Reviews.Author: MrsMUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kensington Park hotel for 4 nights and we couldn't fault it. The location couldn't have been better. Walking distance f rom the cable car pick up, with Macy's, Tiffiany's and the main shopping Mall all within easy walking distance. The hotel was very clean and the staff extremely helpful.
